Dialogue: Jesus Dave! You scared the shit out of me.

Dialogue: So we have the house to ourselves?

Dialogue: Should we make popcorn? Wanna watch TV?

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: No.

Dialogue: Hold on a sec. Check this out. I did this for you.

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: Oh fuck yeah.

Dialogue: Shhh... stop. Dave. What was that?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: What? What was it?

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: I don't know. I heard something.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: It's nothing. It's Julian taking a dump or somethin'. C'mon...

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: I'm serious. Go see.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Go see him take a shit?

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: Go!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Oh fuck me

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: Julian?

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: I saw someone in the hallway, standing outside my door.

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Aww, bro! Ghosts and goblins?

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: Shut up, Dave! I heard him breathin' then I saw him. He's in here. The Boogeyman's in the house!

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: Come on. Let's go see this creature, then get you back to bed.

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: He was standing in the door right there. I closed my eyes. When I opened them, he was gone.

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: That's the last time I show you a scary movie.

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: Vicky?

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Sick bike.

Dialogue: Will you turn on the closet light?

Dialogue: Then you go to sleep for real.

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: Oh shit!!!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Aww. Idiot.

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: Nope.

Speaker: vicky
Dialogue: RUUUUN!!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Dude! Chill. Why are you screechin'?

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: There's a man up there!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: There's no man up there.

Speaker: julian
Dialogue: You go up there, you're gonna get killed, Dave!

Speaker: dave
Dialogue: Oh yeah? Come get some Dave.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Allyson. Come here!

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: What are you doing? What was that?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: I just need a kiss from you.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Looks like you just got one from Kim?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: That was nothing.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Really?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Yeah. Every time I turn around, you're in your phone. Looking at it, texting with people, talking with people. It sucks. And I didn't do anything with Kim. She came up to me. Gave ME a kiss. Don't cry about it.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: You're drunk. Oscar got you fucked up.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Come 'ere. Come on.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Don't.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: See! This piece of shit.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: What the fuck?!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Haddonfield Sheriff's department. Responding to a domestic disturbance!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Hands on your head. Come out NOW!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Stop or I'll fire!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Where is he?!

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Fuck! Jesus! What the fuck?!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: You were told to go home.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I shot him! I almost shot you too.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Did you see which way he went?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: No. But do me do me favor. If you find him before I do, finish him.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Sure. Sure. You get a license for that fire arm, lady?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I do. And this one too.

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: Hawkins, look who's up!

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: You tell me.

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: What I want to know is why he didn't kill you?

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: Hawkins, come talk to me for a second. Doctor, please wait here.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: He's not an asset, he's a liability.

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: You're going to take him. He knows Myers better than anyone.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: You want me to take this injured civilian to search for a psychopathic serial killer?

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: You were right. I was wrong. We're clearing the streets. Patrol cars on every corner. I'm going statewide with this. Let's find this son of a bitch. You hear me?

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: We don't need your help right now, Ms. Strode.

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: Laurie Strode, meet Dr. Sartain.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You're the new Loomis. I can tell by the classy accent.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Loomis calling for his execution didn't persuade you?

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: I used to believe that due process balanced the power of the law of the land. I'm not so sure anymore.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I prayed everyday that he would escape.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: What the hell did you do that for?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: So I could kill him.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Well, that was a dumb thing to pray for...

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: No. I need to protect my family.

Speaker: sheriff barker
Dialogue: We have you covered, ma'am.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Just put it in a bag of rice. It'll be fine.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: I leave you alone for literally two minutes and you run to talk to the one girl that stresses me out. Then you break my phone?!

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Listen. I had too much gin. I told you. Kim was talking to me. She came on to me. I'm trying to be respectful that she still has feelings. I'm sorry. She already has eating issues and I don't want to make it worse. What was I supposed to do?

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: It's ruined. It's totally sticky with fucking Velveeta on it.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Good! Now we actually have to blab to each other. Seriously. Let's have some fun. Please. If we don't this is a completely degrading experience. I'm serious.

Speaker: officer #1
Dialogue: You guys gotta clear out of here. Party's over! Gotta clear out!

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: Curfew has been put into place. It's not safe! You guys need a ride home?

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: What's happening? Why aren't we safe? Why do we need to go?

Speaker: officer #1
Dialogue: Because I fuckin' said so. It's not safe to be on the streets. We need you to get home. Now.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: We were just leaving-

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: No we weren't. Dude. We're in the middle of a fight and we were at the point of a breakthrough when you shined that goddamn flashlight in my face! Why you gotta be dicks-

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Cameron!

Speaker: officer #1
Dialogue: You okay ma'am?

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: Who's your smart ass friend? Come here!  It's been about 48 hours since we got a complaint about your place.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Oh yeah?

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: That's a pretty dress you got on. Your mom dress you up like that?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Go fuck yourself.

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: You say anything about my family again and I'll-

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: I know exactly what you'll do. Assault a police officer. You'll sit on the roof of your garage and throw rotten eggs at me like you did last time.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: I was ten years old and made you look like a bitch in front of your entire department.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: Cameron? What's up dude? Are you being misunderstood again. This is a heartbreaking case of mistaken identity Your Honor.

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: Take him in. He's drunk off his ass on school grounds. We don't have time for this shit.

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Are you serious? Are you fucking serious?!! Allyson!

Speaker: officer #2
Dialogue: Who's the little bitch now?

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Oscar! Get her home safe, man.

Speaker: officer #1
Dialogue: Party's over!

Speaker: cameron
Dialogue: Get her home!

Speaker: shanah
Dialogue: Mom! Do we have to do this-

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I never wanted you to be scared, baby. Never. Just prepared.

Speaker: shanah
Dialogue: Allyson, you need to call me the second you get this. The police said the dance was evacuated and I haven't heard from you. We're heading to your Grandmother's house. We're worried about you.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Where are you, baby? There are police officers at your house. Get to them and they'll bring you to us. We're all together now. We love you...

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: This is an amazing night, right?! Don't you just love Cameron?

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: No. I think he's a jerk.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: He's cool. So bad ass. But I can tell you're pissed about your phone. He plopped it into the chili con queso.  Classic Cameron!

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: I'm tired of people letting me down. You give them the benefit of the doubt and think they're going to be different, but then they show you who they truly are. Cameron doesn't want people to judge him, but then he acts like a jerk. Gets drunk, gets arrested.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: You deserve better. You're the smartest, most beautiful girl at school. Anyone that doesn't appreciate that is crazy.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Thanks Oscar, that's sweet.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: Check it out. 5.0. Let's detour this rendezvous.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: From a clinical perspective, would you say that Laurie Strode has lost her fucking marbles?

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: What side is that?

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Walk a mile in another man's shoes, or something like that, right? Not for me, brother.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: That old place was a shrine kinda- thing but for serial killer groupies and death metal bands. Vandals got the best of it. A local organization that I work with tore it down and turned it into a community garden. Turned tragedy into beauty if you can consider it.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: Watch out for the poison ivy. It's all over.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: This is a dumb short cut.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: Treacherous. Let me give you a hand.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Thanks.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: You deserve better.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Ew. Oscar. What the fuck?!

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: Wait, I thought you said you weren't with Cameron anymore.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Doesn't mean I want- Get away from me.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: I thought you were sending me signals.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Definitely no signals. Just go!

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Please don't tell Cameron I did that. I didn't feel anything either.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: You're disgusting. I'm going home. You need to figure your shit out.

Speaker: oscar
Dialogue: I'm drunk. Like... really drunk, and I got all horny at the party, I was dancing with some girl, this way out of my league girl and my brain got all sexed up, and her tits got me totally chubbed out when she was feeding me guacamole in sexy ways--

Dialogue: Oscar?!! Oscar?!

Dialogue: Help me!! Open the door!

Dialogue: Hello? - Allyson? - Thank God you're all right. Where are you?!

Dialogue: Officer! I saw him. My friend was attacked! He came out of nowhere-

Dialogue: Take a deep breath, Allyson. You're going to be all right. Take a deep breath.

Dialogue: We'll drop you off and wait at the gate for your girl to arrive. We have an officer on the scene in contact with her now.

Dialogue: Home is where the heart is, right Laurie?

Dialogue: I saw your mousetraps, Ray. Peanut butter and marshmallow fluff?

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: What's this?

Dialogue: My childhood.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: It's how we protect ourselves.

Dialogue: 601 to dispatch. I'm 1076 with a witness in custody.

Dialogue: I haven't been to her house in years, but I think I can give you directions from the-

Dialogue: Brace yourself.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Not for long. Stand back.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: I'm finishing this.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Please... Don't.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: No! please no! Please!

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: NO! GET ME OUT OF HERE! HELP!

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Let me go. Please.

Speaker: allyson
Dialogue: Please... Where are you taking me?!

Dialogue: You know what sounds good with a baloney sandwich?

Dialogue: What the hell?

Speaker: officer richards
Dialogue: 601? 606 to 601? Hawkins. Turn your fuckin' radio on. Hawkins?

Speaker: officer francis
Dialogue: Let's check it out.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: Hawkins, please respond.

Speaker: officer hawkins
Dialogue: It's him.

Speaker: officer richards
Dialogue: Hands where I can see `um! DON'T MOVE!!!

Speaker: shanah
Dialogue: I'm scared. I don't know how to do this.

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: You never wanted to listen when I spoke about that night... but this is why. We fight to survive. He is a killer. But he will be killed tonight. I've been preparing for this for a long time. And whether you know it or not, so have you.

Speaker: ray
Dialogue: Any word on Allyson?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: Ray?

Speaker: shanah
Dialogue: Mom?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: He's here Shanah. Michael is here. Go to the shelter and hide. You'll be safe there.

Dialogue: What about Ray? What about Allyson?

Speaker: laurie
Dialogue: I'll take care of it. It's time. Now. It all ends tonight.

Dialogue: It only works if you load it, Sweetheart.

Dialogue: Michael?!

Dialogue: I'm not leaving without you.
